description: Retrieves a list of certificate ARNs and domain names. By default, the API returns RSA_2048 certificates. To return all certificates in the account, include the keyType filter with the values [RSA_1024, RSA_2048, RSA_3072, RSA_4096, EC_prime256v1, EC_secp384r1, EC_secp521r1]. In addition to keyType, you can also filter by the CertificateStatuses, keyUsage, and extendedKeyUsage attributes on the certificate. For more information, see  Filters.

parameters.name: CertificateStatuses
parameters.description: Filter the certificate list by status value. (string) ---

parameters.name: Includes
parameters.description: Filter the certificate list. For more information, see the  Filters structure. extendedKeyUsage (list) --- Specify one or more  ExtendedKeyUsage extension values. (string) --- keyUsage (list) --- Specify one or more  KeyUsage extension values. (string) --- keyTypes (list) --- Specify one or more algorithms that can be used to generate key pairs. Default filtering returns only RSA_1024 and RSA_2048 certificates that have at least one domain. To return other certificate types, provide the desired type signatures in a comma-separated list. For example, "keyTypes": ["RSA_2048","RSA_4096"] returns both RSA_2048 and RSA_4096 certificates. (string) ---

nested_params.name: extendedKeyUsage
nested_params.description: Specify one or more  ExtendedKeyUsage extension values.

nested_params.name: keyUsage
nested_params.description: Specify one or more  KeyUsage extension values.

nested_params.name: keyTypes
nested_params.description: Specify one or more algorithms that can be used to generate key pairs. Default filtering returns only RSA_1024 and RSA_2048 certificates that have at least one domain. To return other certificate types, provide the desired type signatures in a comma-separated list. For example, "keyTypes": ["RSA_2048","RSA_4096"] returns both RSA_2048 and RSA_4096 certificates.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: When the list is truncated, this value is present and contains the value to use for the NextToken parameter in a subsequent pagination request.

nested_items.name: CertificateSummaryList
nested_items.description: A list of ACM certificates.

nested_items.name: CertificateArn
nested_items.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate. This is of the form:

nested_items.name: DomainName
nested_items.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN), such as www.example.com or example.com, for the certificate.

nested_items.name: SubjectAlternativeNameSummaries
nested_items.description: One or more domain names (subject alternative names) included in the certificate. This list contains the domain names that are bound to the public key that is contained in the certificate. The subject alternative names include the canonical domain name (CN) of the certificate and additional domain names that can be used to connect to the website.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: HasAdditionalSubjectAlternativeNames
nested_items.description: When called by  ListCertificates, indicates whether the full list of subject alternative names has been included in the response. If false, the response includes all of the subject alternative names included in the certificate. If true, the response only includes the first 100 subject alternative names included in the certificate. To display the full list of subject alternative names, use  DescribeCertificate.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the certificate.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The source of the certificate. For certificates provided by ACM, this value is AMAZON_ISSUED. For certificates that you imported with  ImportCertificate, this value is IMPORTED. ACM does not provide managed renewal for imported certificates. For more information about the differences between certificates that you import and those that ACM provides, see Importing Certificates in the Certificate Manager User Guide.

nested_items.name: KeyAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The algorithm that was used to generate the public-private key pair.

nested_items.name: KeyUsages
nested_items.description: A list of Key Usage X.509 v3 extension objects. Each object is a string value that identifies the purpose of the public key contained in the certificate. Possible extension values include DIGITAL_SIGNATURE, KEY_ENCHIPHERMENT, NON_REPUDIATION, and more.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExtendedKeyUsages
nested_items.description: Contains a list of Extended Key Usage X.509 v3 extension objects. Each object specifies a purpose for which the certificate public key can be used and consists of a name and an object identifier (OID).
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InUse
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the certificate is currently in use by any Amazon Web Services resources.

nested_items.name: Exported
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the certificate has been exported. This value exists only when the certificate type is PRIVATE.

nested_items.name: RenewalEligibility
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the certificate is eligible for renewal. At this time, only exported private certificates can be renewed with the  RenewCertificate command.

nested_items.name: NotBefore
nested_items.description: The time before which the certificate is not valid.

nested_items.name: NotAfter
nested_items.description: The time after which the certificate is not valid.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The time at which the certificate was requested.

nested_items.name: IssuedAt
nested_items.description: The time at which the certificate was issued. This value exists only when the certificate type is AMAZON_ISSUED.

nested_items.name: ImportedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time when the certificate was imported. This value exists only when the certificate type is IMPORTED.

nested_items.name: RevokedAt
nested_items.description: The time at which the certificate was revoked. This value exists only when the certificate status is REVOKED.
